Object.name: Object
Object.description:
The base class of all objects in Kristal. \
When added to the stage, an object will be updated and rendered.

x.name: x
x.description: The horizontal position of the object, relative to its parent.

y.name: y
y.description: The vertical position of the object, relative to its parent.

init_x.name: init_x
init_x.description: The horizontal position of the object when it was created.

init_y.name: init_y
init_y.description: The vertical position of the object when it was created.

last_x.name: last_x
last_x.description: The horizontal position of the object in the previous frame.

last_y.name: last_y
last_y.description: The vertical position of the object in the previous frame.

color.name: color
color.description:
The color of the object in the form {R, G, B}. \
The values of R, G, and B are between 0 and 1.

alpha.name: alpha
alpha.description: The alpha transparency of the object, between 0 (invisible) and 1 (fully visible).

scale_x.name: scale_x
scale_x.description: The horizontal scale of the object.

scale_y.name: scale_y
scale_y.description: The vertical scale of the object.

rotation.name: rotation
rotation.description: The rotation of the object, in radians. (`0` is right, positive is clockwise)

flip_x.name: flip_x
flip_x.description: Whether the object is flipped horizontally.

flip_y.name: flip_y
flip_y.description: Whether the object is flipped vertically.

inherit_color.name: inherit_color
inherit_color.description: Whether the object's color will be multiplied by its parent's color.

physics.name: physics
physics.description: A table of data, defining ways the object should automatically move when updating.

graphics.name: graphics
graphics.description: A table of data, defining ways the object's properties should automatically update.

origin_x.name: origin_x
origin_x.description:
The horizontal origin of the object. \
Origin is used to define the point that the object is scaled, rotated, and positioned from. \
This determines where the position (0, 0) is within the object. \
\
If `origin_exact` is false, the origin will be a ratio relative to the object's `width` and `height`, meaning an origin of 0.5, 0.5 will cause the object to be centered. \
If it is true, then the origin will be measured in exact pixels.

origin_y.name: origin_y
origin_y.description:
The vertical origin of the object. \
Origin is used to define the point that the object is scaled, rotated, and positioned from. \
This determines where the position (0, 0) is within the object. \
\
If `origin_exact` is false, the origin will be a ratio relative to the object's `width` and `height`, meaning an origin of 0.5, 0.5 will cause the object to be centered. \
If it is true, then the origin will be measured in exact pixels.

origin_exact.name: origin_exact
origin_exact.description: Whether the object's origin is measured as a ratio of its `width` and `height`, or in exact pixels. (Defaults to false)

scale_origin_x.name: scale_origin_x
scale_origin_x.description:
The horizontal scale origin of the object. \
Scale origin overrides the object's origin, and defines where the object will scale from.

scale_origin_y.name: scale_origin_y
scale_origin_y.description:
The vertical scale origin of the object. \
Scale origin overrides the object's origin, and defines where the object will scale from.

scale_origin_exact.name: scale_origin_exact
scale_origin_exact.description: Whether the object's scale origin is measured as a ratio of its `width` and `height`, or in exact pixels. (Defaults to false)

rotation_origin_x.name: rotation_origin_x
rotation_origin_x.description:
The horizontal rotation origin of the object. \
Rotation origin overrides the object's origin, and defines where the object will rotate from.

rotation_origin_y.name: rotation_origin_y
rotation_origin_y.description:
The vertical rotation origin of the object. \
Rotation origin overrides the object's origin, and defines where the object will rotate from.

rotation_origin_exact.name: rotation_origin_exact
rotation_origin_exact.description: Whether the object's rotation origin is measured as a ratio of its `width` and `height`, or in exact pixels. (Defaults to false)

camera_origin_x.name: camera_origin_x
camera_origin_x.description:
The horizontal camera origin of the object. (Defaults to 0.5) \
Camera origin defines what position on the object a camera attached to it should follow.

camera_origin_y.name: camera_origin_y
camera_origin_y.description:
The vertical camera origin of the object. (Defaults to 0.5) \
Camera origin defines what position on the object a camera attached to it should follow.

camera_origin_exact.name: camera_origin_exact
camera_origin_exact.description: Whether the object's camera origin is measured as a ratio of its `width` and `height`, or in exact pixels. (Defaults to false)

parallax_x.name: parallax_x
parallax_x.description:
How much an object's position will be affected by the camera horizontally. \
A value of 1 means it fully moves with the camera (aka default behavior), and a value of 0 means it will not move at all when the camera moves. \
Parallax will only affect an object if its parent has a camera.

parallax_y.name: parallax_y
parallax_y.description:
How much an object's position will be affected by the camera vertically. \
A value of 1 means it fully moves with the camera (aka default behavior), and a value of 0 means it will not move at all when the camera moves. \
Parallax will only affect an object if its parent has a camera.

parallax_origin_x.name: parallax_origin_x
parallax_origin_x.description: The horizontal position on the object's parent that the object's parallax will orient around.

parallax_origin_y.name: parallax_origin_y
parallax_origin_y.description: The vertical position on the object's parent that the object's parallax will orient around.

camera.name: camera
camera.description: A camera instance that will automatically move and scale the object and its children. Should be `nil` for most objects.

cutout_left.name: cutout_left
cutout_left.description: The amount of pixels to cut from the left of the object when drawing.

cutout_top.name: cutout_top
cutout_top.description: The amount of pixels to cut from the top of the object when drawing.

cutout_right.name: cutout_right
cutout_right.description: The amount of pixels to cut from the right of the object when drawing.

cutout_bottom.name: cutout_bottom
cutout_bottom.description: The amount of pixels to cut from the bottom of the object when drawing.

draw_fx.name: draw_fx
draw_fx.description: A list of all DrawFX that are being applied to the object.

debug_select.name: debug_select
debug_select.description: Whether the object can be selected by the Object Selection debug feature. (Defaults to true)

debug_rect.name: debug_rect
debug_rect.description: Defines the rectangle used for selecting the object with the Object Selection debug feature.

timescale.name: timescale
timescale.description: A multiplier that determines the speed at which the object updates.

layer.name: layer
layer.description:
The layer of the object within its parent. \
Objects update and draw their children in order sorted by layer. Objects with a higher layer will update and draw later than objects with lower layers. \
\
All children of an object will draw at the same visual layer as the parent. In other words, a child cannot render above an object that is higher than its parent, even if its own layer is higher.

collider.name: collider
collider.description: A Collider class used to check collision with other objects.

collidable.name: collidable
collidable.description: Whether the object should be able to collide with other objects.

active.name: active
active.description: Whether the object should update itself and its children.

visible.name: visible
visible.description: Whether the object should draw itself and its children.

draw_children_below.name: draw_children_below
draw_children_below.description: If defined, children with a layer less than this value will be drawn underneath the object.

draw_children_above.name: draw_children_above
draw_children_above.description: If defined, children with a layer greater than this value will be drawn above the object.

_dont_draw_children.name: _dont_draw_children
_dont_draw_children.description: *(Used internally)* Whether the object should draw its children or not.

update_child_list.name: update_child_list
update_child_list.description: *(Used internally)* If true, the object will re-sort its children list.

children_to_remove.name: children_to_remove
children_to_remove.description: *(Used internally)* A list of children for the object to remove next time it updates.

children.name: children
children.description: A list of all of this object's children.

physics_table.name: physics_table
physics_table.description:
Begin caching the transforms of all objects. \
This should be called before any collision checks, and ended with Object.endCache(). \
If an object is moved mid-cache, call Object.uncache() on it.
End caching the transforms of all objects (started with Object.startCache()).
*(Called internally)* Clears all cached transforms, and force-stops caching.
Uncache an object's transform, if Object.startCache() is active. \
This recalculates the object's transform and all of its children, incase it was moved.
*(Called internally)* Uncaches an object's full transform, including all of its children.
*(Override)* Called every frame by its parent if the object is active. \
By default, updates its physics and graphics tables, and its children.
*(Override)* Called every frame by its parent during drawing if the object is visible. \
By default, draws its children.
*(Override)* Called when the object is added to a parent object via `parent:addChild(self)` or `self:setParent(parent)`.
*(Override)* Called when the object is removed from its parent object via `self:remove()`, `parent:removeChild(self)`, or `self:setParent(new_parent)`.
*(Override)* Called when the object is first added to the Game stage, via `parent:addChild(self)` or `self:setParent(parent)`. \
Will not be called when changing to a new parent via `self:setParent(new_parent)` if the object had a parent prior.
*(Override)* Called when the object is removed from the Game stage via `self:remove()` or `parent:removeChild(self)`. \
Will not be called when changing to a new parent via `self:setParent(new_parent)`.

speed_x.name: speed_x
speed_x.description: The horizontal speed of the object, in pixels per frame at 30FPS.

speed_y.name: speed_y
speed_y.description: The vertical speed of the object, in pixels per frame at 30FPS.

speed.name: speed
speed.description: The speed the object will move in the angle of its direction, in pixels per frame at 30FPS.

direction.name: direction
direction.description: The angle at which the object will move, in radians.

friction.name: friction
friction.description: The amount the object's speed will slow down, per frame at 30FPS.

gravity.name: gravity
gravity.description: The amount the object's speed will accelerate towards its gravity direction, per frame at 30FPS.

gravity_direction.name: gravity_direction
gravity_direction.description: The angle at which the object's gravity will accelerate towards, in radians.

spin.name: spin
spin.description: The amount this object's direction will change, in radians per frame at 30FPS.

match_rotation.name: match_rotation
match_rotation.description: Whether the object's rotation should also define its direction. (Defaults to false)

graphics_table.name: graphics_table
graphics_table.description:
Resets all of the object's `physics` table values to their default values, \
making it so it will stop moving if it was before.
Resets the object's `physics` and sets new values for it.

fade.name: fade
fade.description: The amount the object's alpha should approach its target value, per frame at 30FPS.

fade_callback.name: fade_callback
fade_callback.description: A function that will be called when the object's alpha reaches its target value.

grow_x.name: grow_x
grow_x.description: The amount the object's `scale_x` will increase, per frame at 30FPS.

grow_y.name: grow_y
grow_y.description: The amount the object's `scale_y` will increase, per frame at 30FPS.

grow.name: grow
grow.description: The amount the object's `scale_x` and `scale_y` will increase, per frame at 30FPS.

remove_shrunk.name: remove_shrunk
remove_shrunk.description: If true, the object will remove itself if its scale goes below 0. (Defaults to false)

spin.name: spin
spin.description: The amount the object's `rotation` will change, per frame at 30FPS.

shake_x.name: shake_x
shake_x.description: The amount the object will shake in the `x` axis, per frame at 30FPS.

shake_y.name: shake_y
shake_y.description: The amount the object will shake in the `y` axis, per frame at 30FPS.

shake_friction.name: shake_friction
shake_friction.description: The amount the object's shake will slow down, per frame at 30FPS.

shake_delay.name: shake_delay
shake_delay.description: The time it takes for the object to invert its shake direction, in seconds.

shake_timer.name: shake_timer
shake_timer.description: *(Used internally)* A timer used to invert the object's shake direction.

Sprite.name: Sprite
Sprite.description:
A simple object that renders a texture. \
This texture must be placed inside `assets/sprites/`.

texture.name: texture
texture.description: .Image|nil   *(Read-only)* The current texture of the sprite, if it exists.

texture_path.name: texture_path
texture_path.description: *(Read-only)* The string ID of the current texture, if it exists.

frames.name: frames
frames.description: .Image[]|nil *(Read-only)* The animation frames of the sprite, or `nil` if the texture has no frames.

frame.name: frame
frame.description: *(Read-only)* The current frame of the sprite. Set with `Sprite:setFrame()`.

path.name: path
path.description:
The base path of the sprite. \
Any calls to `Sprite:setSprite()` will have this path prepended to them,\
only checking for textures inside this folder. \
**Note**: *This path is still relative to `assets/sprites/`!*

use_texture_size.name: use_texture_size
use_texture_size.description:
Whether this sprite's `width` and `height` will be updated to the size of the texture. \
Defaults to `true` if a width and height is not specified in the constructor.

wrap_texture_x.name: wrap_texture_x
wrap_texture_x.description: If enabled, the texture will repeat horizontally across the screen.

wrap_texture_y.name: wrap_texture_y
wrap_texture_y.description: If enabled, the texture will repeat vertically across the screen.

loop.name: loop
loop.description: Whether the sprite will continuously loop its animation. (Defaults to `false`)

playing.name: playing
playing.description: *(Read-only)* Whether an animation is currently playing.

anim_speed.name: anim_speed
anim_speed.description: A multiplier for how fast the sprite animates. (Defaults to `1`)

anim_sprite.name: anim_sprite
anim_sprite.description: *(Read-only)* The name of the sprite used in the current animation.

anim_delay.name: anim_delay
anim_delay.description: *(Read-only)* The delay between frames in the current animation.

anim_frames.name: anim_frames
anim_frames.description: []|nil *(Read-only)* A list of frame indexes the current animation loops through. If `nil`, the animation loops through all frames.

anim_duration.name: anim_duration
anim_duration.description: *(Read-only)* The duration of the current animation. If greater than 0, the animation will stop after this many seconds.

anim_waiting.name: anim_waiting
anim_waiting.description: *(Read-only)* Set by the `wait` function of an animation routine. The amount of time left until the animation continues.

anim_callback.name: anim_callback
anim_callback.description: .anim_callback|nil  A function that is called when the current animation finishes.

anim_routine.name: anim_routine
anim_routine.description: *(Read-only)* The coroutine of the current sprite animation.

anim_routine_func.name: anim_routine_func
anim_routine_func.description: .anim_func|nil      *(Read-only)* The function of the current sprite animation.

anim_wait_func.name: anim_wait_func
anim_wait_func.description: .wait_func          *(Read-only)* The function used to wait for the next frame of the animation.

options.name: options
options.description: <string, {id: string, name: string, options: {name: string, value: (fun(x:number, y:number):any)|nil, callback: fun()}[]}>
